values:
I was having a pretty good day and now it turned to crap. Things need to change. Live Journal is the devil. So are dinning commons.

Goodbye.
There are days when you watch a film that changes your life. Today was one of those days.

You don't tolerate shit. The .45 you carry in you pocket is scary, but your words are the real threat, especially when you decide to get Biblical. Try to take it easy, but maintain that edge of yours, which tends to keep people wary in your presence.

Take the What Pulp Fiction Character Are You? quiz.

You Are Richie! You chill in a tent, listening to
The Rolling Stones in the sleeping bag you
slept in with Margot when you lived in the
museum together. As a child, you played drums,
collected toy cars, spoke on your HAM radio,
played tennis, and painted portraits of Margot.
The only thing you really developed in was
tennis, so much so that you went Pro before the
age of eighteen. Your athletic meltdown,
however, occured when you still had a few years
left, breaking down in the middle of the game,
because Margot had gotten married the day
before. Oh how you longed for her. You went
on a cruise around the world to get away from
her, but absense only made your heart grow
fonder. You attempted suicide when you found
that she was having an affair with Eli, but
you'll never do it again because you now know
she cares.
Good to know that you can always count on friends.
I'm tired, my throat hurts, I'm INCREDIBLY ANNOYED, and my lip is bugging me again. I hate feeling like this! Snap out of it already!

See, I knew that was the right thing to do. Ever since I chose not to do it I have been in a creative high. I'm ready to take on the world. Bring it. So this is not too much of an entry, but what can you do, eh?
Funny story, today I had class at 8 and I woke up at 8.15. Well, maybe it's not that funny. I made it (late) and I felt like a price fool. Good times!
Just wanted to let the world know that I have never been this stressed out!!!! EVER!!!!
Reading some live journals puts me in a bad mood. Maybe I'm doomed to be annoyed at people for the rest of my days. On a lighter note, my life is pretty damn good.
Not drunk... maybe a bit tipsy... lot of drunk people in my house though. Now I'm really tired. Had the best Champagne in the world.
Okay, record-time update. Got back from snowboarding yesterday, it was amazing. Know what? Don't really feel like updating anymore. And I have to go. Later
Mr. Nguyen's Xanga: Another example of wit ruined by high school stupidity.
Just for the record: I'm an idiot.
I'm contemplating never looking at my friends page again. Could be a nice change.
So... It turns out that Kristin Chenoweth is in The West Wing. Awesome.

It's amazing how spending a couple of minutes with someone can put you in such an amazing mood. I'm really glad that I got to see Claire before she left for New Zeland; God only knows how many things we talked about, but those have been the best 30 minutes of my break so far. Times like these make me realize how much I miss talking to her, and how hard it is for me to find someone I can honestly relate to. 

Great times! I hope she has a blast in New Zeland... and as for me, I get to figure out what to do with all this free time!
Why don't I give a rat's ass about anyone right now? Oh well.

WOOOOO... Yeah, done with all my finals, done with the first quarter of my first year of college! God this feels good. I didn't do nearly as bad in any of my finals as I was expecting, so that rocks! Okay, I'm off to find something to do that does not involve studying!!!

* Computer
* 4 Piranha Energy Drinks
* 2 Three Musketeers
* 2 Bottles of Water
* Lots of other stuff that doesn't really pertain to finals.

I think I'm set... Finals, here I go!

When I was reading my friend's journal a couple of minutes ago, I realized that she had managed to put into words something that's been in my head for at least a couple of months. She wrote that much like other people, she sees a division between who she thinks she is and who others thinks she is. The problem is that she is tired of people assuming that she's only the "loud and exaggerated" persona that they see, as opposed to the "quiet and introspective" persona that she rarely shows in public.

Truth is, I feel very much the same way. Ever since I got to UCSB I've been labeled as this crazy and silly theatre major, and people often overlook the quiet and reserved side of me, which much like my friend, I scarcely show in public. I am also tired of having to explain myself when I am not my usual hyperactive self... in fact, this introverted, quiet and strangely artistic side of me is much more closer to who I consider myself to be. Yes, I enjoy being random once in a while, but I want everyone to understand that this is not all I am. In her words, "I am who I am", and I like being spontaneous and reserved at the same time. So if I decide to turn to my more reserved side once in a while, it doesn't mean that I am bored, or upset, or in a bad mood, it just means I'm being myself. 

I like being random when I genuinely feel the need to be, not just when it's expected of me.
Hey, guess what? It's finals week. Guess what else? My finals are worth from 25-40% of my grade! So now what?! Study time.
I took a quiz. It told me that I was a hopeless romantic. I already knewy that. I like it that way.

Just wanted to take a second to say that Christmas kicks ass. 

Thanks for listening.

Great. So I'm back at FT. Jason's asleep, and his crap is all over the place (not really surprised about either of those). I got some of my stuff set, but I still have quite a bit to unpack. Going home was beyond amazing since I got to spend some quaity time with my family and old friends. It was also fun getting to drive again; really can't get enough of that when your primary means of transportation is... well... public? Anyway, now that I'm back I have a lot of work to get done. At least I have 24/7 quiet hours...

Night everyone.

Wow, it was great seeing all my kids again. I really missed all of them a lot... actually, I just want to take a second and thank Laura for being so amazing and inviting everyone over! Talking to evereyone and catching up was definitely the highlight of the night (that or hanging out in the bathroom with Karen, Laura and Steve), regardless... tonight was a blast. I'm a bit tired, Rockstar wearing off, guess I'm going to sleep. Right now I'm talking to Jeff Hamilton, but I really doubt that I'm making any sense. 

Well, tomorrow I get to hang with my parents. Better get some sleep. Night you princes of Main, kings of New England.

It has really been a long time since I slept in my bed at home. I never thought that I would be so anxious to go back to all the crazy things that I left behind when I came to SB. This is going to be a really busy weekend, but guess what?!! I can't wait to drive a car again, to spend half an hour in the shower, to be able to sing in my room without people staring at me thinking that I am insane. Oh, sweet home, why do I love thee so?  I still have to write a paper for Art History, but I really don't mind because I'm writing it in my room! YOU HEAR THAT JASON!? MY ROOM!!!!!! NO FAN, NO MIDNIGHT TYPING, NO SMELLY LAUNDRY!!!

I can't wait!

This was an awesome weekend! I was really happy to see Nicole and Megan again, I miss my kids a lot! I hung out with them and Laura all weekend long, and now it's time for me to do some work.

I really wish I had something else to say.

I can't wait to go home!
Sometimes life has a way of kicking you in the ass when you least expect it. I wrote about 20 things. That's not good.

Okay, my arm still hurts a lot, but at least I can use it to type. That's a good thing I believe. Now, what actually happened last night: as I was leaving San Mig from an amazing night with friends, I got my bike and started speeding through sand (now those of you who've tried riding a bike through sandy concrete know why that is not a very good idea) and believe it or not, my back tire gave out on me and I flew over my handle bars and landed on my right arm and my beloved iPod (the iPod's okay, no worries). The adrenaline that I built up from the accident allowed me to get back to FT okay. It was really weird because I kept noticing how breathtaking the sky was last night. I got back to my room, with this horrible pain shooting up my right arm, so I took some advil, cleaned my knee (didn't even care that I had gotten blood all over my pants) and just gave out. I slept okay, Jason woke me up (but he always does that... moron) and I woke up pretty much the same. Good thing is that my wrist doesn't hurt that much, and I can bend my arm a bit more than I could yesterday... that's a really good thing because I can now type with both hands, 

Conclusion: Not too bad, I've had worse. Just suck it up for a couple of days and I'll be okay. 

Love you guys.
i just ate shit. i wiped out and fell of my bike. can barely move my right arm, so i'm typing with my left. hurts a lot too. i need to sleep. more on the accident later... when i can move.

I really don't know what to say. Not because I don't have anything to say, trust me, I do. I just don't know where to start... as a matter of fact, I have know idea what I would say at all.

I'm confused.

*

I just got back to my dorm after one and a half days of hanging out with my family. Wow, I had such a great time! I got to show my parents around campus and my sister got to hang out at the library for a good 5 hours! We walked around State Street where we ran into Laura and her family-- aw, good times. We had lunch there and then we walked around for some time. I made my sister buy the first two seasons of Coupling at Borders, and we looked at random furniture at Urban Outfitters. Later on in the evening we  went to dinner at the same restaurant where Laura and I had dessert on my birthday... it was okay, not as good as I was hoping it would be. We returned to our hotel room where we had Champagne to celebrate my birthday, and watched SNL's Best of Tom Hanks (not that funny).

 I'm really happy that I got see my family after all this time, they're awesome! I got some pretty awesome birthday gifts (some leather gloves, BIG FISH, and a white tie among other things). Now I have to return to the make-belief world of UCSB, and good ol' homework!

Good morning, and in case I don't see ya, good day, good evening and good night!

You Are a New School Democrat

You like partying and politics - and are likely to be young and affluent. You're less religious, traditional, and uptight than most Democrats. Smoking pot, homosexuality, and gambling are all okay in your book. You prefer that the government help people take care of themselves.
What political persuasion are you?
Sorry about that, couldn't help myself...

Just when you started hoping that Americans had learned their lesson...

Damn it!

There are only 10 reasons for reading this entry on 11.2.04 instead of voting...

1. You can't vote. (Like me!)
2. You got shot in the face.
3. You already voted.
4. You are about to go vote.
5. You are lame like my room mate and didn't register because you don't give a crap about anything!
6. You forgot who you are.
7. There is a terrorist outside your door.
8. Someone broke both your legs.
9. You are stranded in the Congo.
10. You forgot how to read-- then how are you reading this entry!?

So yeah, go out and vote, if not for yourself, do it for me. JUST DO IT!

I guess I should write and entry and tell you all about my birthday. Be warned, some of the facts will be condensed for the sake of laziness...

Well, it was amazing! It all started the 29th at about 11:30 when we started watching Reality Bites... Thirty minutes later I turned 18! I went back to my dorm where I indulged in a brief session of SNL's Best of Christopher Walken.

I woke up really late and took the longest shower I've ever taken in my life. I got my suit and went over to Laura's dorm at about 4:00, where I got some of the BEST presents I've ever had: two words (BONZAI POTATO). Then, after much ado about nothing (and I'm not talking about the play) Laura Lucas looking AMAZING and yours truly went our way to State Street.

When we got there we walked around for a while until we reached Bucatini where we had an excellent, garlic-filled dinner. After dinner, we left and since we still had more than an hour before the play started we decided to walk around. In our walk we found this amazing place "a l'europe" with all these awesome stores that I will never be able to afford. We continued walking in our never-ending search for the theatre (and somewhere to have dessert), when we ran in to the MOST EXTRAORDINARILY AMAZING restaurant in Santa Barbara. For the sake of secrecy i won't reveal the name of said restaurant (It's mine and YOU can't have it!). We had desert (mmmm.... creme brulee) and left running for the theatre.

The play (Stoppard's The Real Thing) was amazing... Laura was right, it reminded me of a CTC production. SO TO ALL THOSE PEOPLE WHO COMPLAINED ABOUT THIS PLAY, SHOVE IT! (I have no idea what they were smoking, my guess is crack). Walking back to the bus stop we met the Grim Ripper and some really colorful characters, here's a brief re-enactment...


Laura and I are walking.

There's a guy peeing on the street.

Other Random Drunk Guy: Hey, what the %&#$ are you doing?!
"Pissed" Drunk Guy: Nothing...

We walk by. Drunk people start walking behind us.

"Pissed" Guy (to Laura): Hey it's Wilma...
                              It's not Wilma...
                              What is it?!!
We walk away.

We then took the bus back to UCSB where we could hear the roaring crowd getting drunk in IV. Once we got back to Laura's dorm we watched SNL make fun of Ashley Simpson, talked, sang in the dark, talked some more, and then I fell asleep. I don't remember a thing.

Good Times.

The End.

Birthday firsts:

First to wish me Happy Birthday: Laura Lucas
First to give me a Birthday present: Mitzi Perez
First Birthday email: Adam Jacobs
First Birthday card: Kristen Imboden

*Just thought I should add one more category!*

First person to wish me Happy Birthday before my birthday: KAREN BASKIND!

Daydream, delusion, limousine, eyelash 
Oh baby with your pretty face 
Drop a tear in my wineglass 
Look at those big eyes 
See what you mean to me
Sweet-cakes and milkshakes
I'm delusion angel
I'm fantasy parade 
I want you to know what I think
Don't want you to guess anymore
You have no idea where I came from
We have no idea where we're going
Latched in life
Like branches in a river
Flowing downstream
Caught in the current
I'll carry you 
You'll carry me
That's how it could be 
Don't you know me?
Don't you know me by now?

-Before Sunrise

And this is why I'm proud to say that I had him as my English AP teacher.

http://www.xanga.com/MistuhWhen
It's friends like you that make me realize how lucky I am.

Laura just called me to say (and I quote) "naked women, naked women, naked women!"

I LOVE LAURA LUCAS!!! She made my night! Now... more reading!

I just finished my first college paper ever!!!! And guess what? It doesn't suck that much. (God bless you Mr. Nguyen!)

Just in case you are wondering, it was for History of Art on some crazy Roman head...

I'm still sick.

I don't care!

Yesterday I had a really bad case of allergies (which is very unusual). Last night I got completely soaked riding back to FT. Today I'm VERY sick!

I hate this! I need some soup...

Wow. Today has been the most amazing and insane day of my life. I left 10 minutes early from History of Philosophy so I could go early to my Dramatic Arts 1 lecture... why you ask? Well, we had a "special" speaker coming, and by "special" I mean... I don't know how to phrase it... TONY KUSHNER!!! (Playwright of Angels In America, Illusion, and other awesome plays). It was by far the most surreal experience of my life. He was sitting directly in front of me (a couple of feet away) talking for 50 minutes about his work. I'm speechless.

That's not all. At eight I went to see him again, but this time it was at Campbell Hall, where he read a scene from his new play about Laura Bush, followed by an interview/discussion with actor Jeff Bridges. That was beyond amazing. It was mostly political in nature, but I couldn't care less because it was Tony Kushner and Jeff Bridges... on stage... talking... hell, they could've read a dictionary for two hours, I don't care! Besides, they had great ideas and comments so it was way worth it.

I honestly don't know what to say. This has totally reaffirmed my reasons for doing what I do!
